page.title: 06Stythians Church, Stithians
page.content: The Parish Church of St Stythians is an active part of village life. It is not known who St Stythian or Etienne was or whether the saint was male or female.The vicar conducts two services each Sunday (mainly Eucharists but with Mattins once a month) as well as other services including baptisms, marriages and funerals.There were eight burials so far this year and the vicar believes: "In Stithians more people are being buried than cremated". The site of the church as a place of worship, goes back to Celtic times. Outside the churchyard is a Celtic cross. Parts of the church are quite old. The damaged Bodmin font is 12th century and the arches are 15th and 13th centuries, but much of the church was restored in the 19th century. Some people worship in {Penmenor Methodist chapel.
